content:
• Thursday, December 22, 2011
  • RMBS

    Memory technology developer Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS) gains 7.8% AH after announcing a 5-year patent...

    Memory technology developer Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS) gains 7.8% AH after announcing a 5-year patent license agreement with Broadcom (BRCM), and stating the two companies "have settled all outstanding claims." Given Broadcom's $7B+ in annual sales, and the large number of chips it sells that embed memory or interface with memory chips, the deal could be a lucrative one for Rambus.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • KODK

    Eastman Kodak (EK) jumps 23.8% AH after announcing it's selling its gelatin business (Eastman...

    Eastman Kodak (EK) jumps 23.8% AH after announcing it's selling its gelatin business (Eastman Gelatine) to privately-owned Vion Food Group, and has elected General Counsel Laura Quatela as President. Quatela will hold the position in tandem with current President Philip Faraci.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM
  • MNTA

    Momenta Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MNTA) gains 5.7% AH after announcing it has entered into a...

    Momenta Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MNTA) gains 5.7% AH after announcing it has entered into a collaboration with Baxter (NYSE:BAX) to develop a class of drugs called biosimilars. As part of the deal, Baxter will make a $33M up-front payment to Momenta related to the development of six drug compounds, and "may make additional payments over the next several years."
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • WNC

    "Tonnage levels continue to point to an economy that is growing, not sliding into a recession,"...

    "Tonnage levels continue to point to an economy that is growing, not sliding into a recession," the American Trucking Association says as November data shows truck tonnage rising 6% Y/Y. Shares of truck manufacturer Wabash (WNC +10.1%) jump; truck builder Oshkosh (OSK +2.4%) and parts maker Wabco (WBC +5%) also rally.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 6 Comments
  • GS

    Goldman Sachs (GS +2.5%) bounces back after an S&P spokesman says the company hasn't made a...

    Goldman Sachs (GS +2.5%) bounces back after an S&P spokesman says the company hasn't made a downgrade, as had been reported. Data on S&P's website indicating a downgrade appears to be responsible for the reports.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • AKRX

    Akorn (AKRX +5%) trades higher after announcing that it purchased 3 off-patent branded...

    Akorn (AKRX +5%) trades higher after announcing that it purchased 3 off-patent branded injectables from Denmark's Lundbeck for an upfront payment of $45M and a milestone payment of $15M after 3 years. The firm's CEO says the products will add to its niche portfolio of hospital-based injectables.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • SINA

    Sina (SINA +3%) spikes in afternoon trading on a report Russia's Digital Sky Technology has made...

    Sina (SINA +3%) spikes in afternoon trading on a report Russia's Digital Sky Technology has made a $200M investment in Sina's Weibo microblogging platform. The investment is said to feature a convertible note offering with a conversion price of $65/share, and to value Weibo, which now claims over 200M registered users, at roughly $1B.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • AMCC

    BMO Capital starts coverage of Applied Micro Circuits (AMCC +3.5%) at Outperform, writing that...

    BMO Capital starts coverage of Applied Micro Circuits (AMCC +3.5%) at Outperform, writing that the company's decision to start making chips for the server market in competition with Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) increases the attractiveness of the stock’s risk and reward trade-off. AMCC is one of the first firms to design and market a 64-bit server chip based on ARM technology.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • GS

    S&P cuts its rating on Goldman Sachs (NYSE:GS) to A+ from AA-. Shares of GS tilt lower on...

    S&P cuts its rating on Goldman Sachs (NYSE:GS) to A+ from AA-. Shares of GS tilt lower on the news, and are now up 1.6% after posting a 3% gain in trading earlier.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • SD

    SandRidge Energy (SD +19.2%) takes off, and trips up circuit breaks along the way, after...

    SandRidge Energy (SD +19.2%) takes off, and trips up circuit breaks along the way, after Bloomberg reports Spain's Repsol (OTCQX:REPYY) will invest $1B in its Mississippi Lime oil project.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • MIPS

    MIPS is up 7.8% after announcing its CPU cores support the latest version of Android (Ice Cream...

    MIPS is up 7.8% after announcing its CPU cores support the latest version of Android (Ice Cream Sandwich). Earlier this month, MIPS announced a partnership with Chinese chipmaker Ingenic Semiconductor offer a sub-$100 Android tablet. The company has high hopes for Android, but the current market dominance of processors featuring ARM (NASDAQ:ARMH) CPU cores presents a major challenge.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • TOL

    The chairman of Toll Brothers (TOL -1%), Robert Toll, sold 1M shares of the company he helped...

    The chairman of Toll Brothers (TOL -1%), Robert Toll, sold 1M shares of the company he helped found, according to a SEC filing. Shares of TOL are up over 50% from their summer lows.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • BB

    If BGR's source is right, the reason Research In Motion's (RIMM +1.2%) BlackBerry 10 OS is being...

    If BGR's source is right, the reason Research In Motion's (RIMM +1.2%) BlackBerry 10 OS is being delayed until late 2012 has nothing to do with a chip issue, as co-CEO Mike Laziridis claimed last week. Instead, the delay is because RIM doesn't "have a working product yet." The source also claims the BlackBerry 8700, released in 2006, features better messaging capabilities than what's currently sported by RIM's next-gen OS. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • BK

    BNY Mellon (BK +2.3%) agrees to pay $1.3M to settle an auction-rate securities case that was...

    BNY Mellon (BK +2.3%) agrees to pay $1.3M to settle an auction-rate securities case that was being investigated by authorities in Texas, New York, and Florida.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM
  • STJ

    St. Jude (STJ +4.3%) shares rebound after a webinar for doctors indicates that problems with...

    St. Jude (STJ +4.3%) shares rebound after a webinar for doctors indicates that problems with wire “leads” for its Riata implantable defibrillator appear to be limited to older models, in less than 2,000 of 79,000 patients currently using it. Analysts' fears are eased; Leerink Swank does not expect Riata concerns will alter STJ's market share gaining trajectory.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • C

    Bank stocks are outperforming (XLF +1.6%) following a rally in European markets, and...

    Bank stocks are outperforming (XLF +1.6%) following a rally in European markets, and better-than-expected jobless claims data. Citigroup (C +6.2%) is leading the way, and Morgan Stanley (MS +4.1%) is also up strongly.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • CBOE

    CBOE Holdings (CBOE -2.9%) long been seen as a takeover target, but Macquarie downgrades its...

    CBOE Holdings (CBOE -2.9%) long been seen as a takeover target, but Macquarie downgrades its stock to Neutral from Outperform on expectations of a limited upside from a sale and slower trading activity. Macquarie now considers CME (CME +1.8%) the only potential dance partner for CBOE.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • MSFT

    Sohu.com (SOHU +4.4%) trades higher after forming a "strategic partnership" with Taiwan's Asus,...

    Sohu.com (SOHU +4.4%) trades higher after forming a "strategic partnership" with Taiwan's Asus, in which Sohu's online video content will be integrated with Asus' PCs and tablets. In November, Sohu struck a deal to have its video content used by MSN China (NASDAQ:MSFT) on its site.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • PHH

    Shares of PHH (PHH -26.1%) plummet after S&P downgrades the long-term credit rating of the...

    Shares of PHH (PHH -26.1%) plummet after S&P downgrades the long-term credit rating of the provider of mortgage and fleet management outsourcing services. PHH has $423M in senior unsecured notes due in March 2013, and S&P does not believe the company will be able to repay exclusively from free corporate cash flows.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • AKAM

    The Street heaps praise on Akamai's (AKAM +18.9%) acquisition of Cotendo. S&P believes the...

    The Street heaps praise on Akamai's (AKAM +18.9%) acquisition of Cotendo. S&P believes the deal will strengthen AKAM’s "technology, offerings, customer base, pricing, and potential for innovation and growth." Jefferies says it “solidifies AKAM’s position in the app/site acceleration space," and places its Underperform rating on the stock "under review."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • TRIP

    TripAdvisor (TRIP -1.2%) continues to sell off, and Expedia continues to rise (EXPE +2.1%),...

    TripAdvisor (TRIP -1.2%) continues to sell off, and Expedia continues to rise (EXPE +2.1%), following yesterday's spinoff. The selling pressure in TripAdvisor could be due to Morgan Stanley's decision to launch coverage at Underweight: the firm is worried about competition, a high valuation, and an expected 2012 margin decline. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • VMI

    Stifel Nicolaus reiterates a Buy rating on Valmont Industries (VMI +1.5%) in the wake of the...

    Stifel Nicolaus reiterates a Buy rating on Valmont Industries (VMI +1.5%) in the wake of the firm's 2011 profit revision. Analyst with the firm estimate that the fabricate metal producer will capture market share as the demand for transmission structures exceeds industry capacity.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • KBH

    Stifel Nicolaus follows up a warning on homebuilders, advising investors to sell into recent...

    Stifel Nicolaus follows up a warning on homebuilders, advising investors to sell into recent strength, with a downgrade of KB Homes (KBH -4%). KBH has been leveraging in anticipation of a housing recovery for five years, and the firm doesn't see a recovery occurring soon enough or fast enough to make this rewarding. KBH's FQ4 cash was $479M, well below $1.02B a year ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (DMND +10.8%) has spiked higher in the last 30 minutes of trading. No news has hit...

    Diamond Foods (DMND +10.8%) has spiked higher in the last 30 minutes of trading. No news has hit the wires that could explain the move, but it's worth noting that 60% of Diamond's float was shorted as of Nov. 30, making it very easy for a rumor to trigger a short squeeze. (more on DMND)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • TIBX

    Tibco (TIBX +6.7%) is adding to the gains it saw yesterday after delivering FQ1 guidance, and an...

    Tibco (TIBX +6.7%) is adding to the gains it saw yesterday after delivering FQ1 guidance, and an upgrade to Buy from Mizuho's Gabriel Lowy could be helping. Lowy is pleased with Tibco's FQ4 results, given a challenging macro climate, and thinks its solutions for enabling service-oriented architectures put it "at the center of one of the most significant re-architecting of IT systems in a generation." (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • CPY

    It's not just CPI's (CPY -54.5%) weak Q3 results that are crushing shares; the company amended...

    It's not just CPI's (CPY -54.5%) weak Q3 results that are crushing shares; the company amended its credit agreement to suspend the leverage ratio test for Q3 or it would not have been in compliance, and the amendment reduced its revolving commitment to $90M from $105M. It also suspended dividend and other restricted payments, including share repurchases.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • DELL

    Ticonderoga initiates coverage of EMC (EMC +1.7%) at Buy with a $27 price target, citing bright...

    Ticonderoga initiates coverage of EMC (EMC +1.7%) at Buy with a $27 price target, citing bright prospects in cloud computing: "EMC is a very different company compared to just a few years ago, with a much broader and deeper storage portfolio that [expands its] market opportunity and better positions the company to support customers moving to a cloud environment."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • MU

    Though it just issued another weak earnings report (I, II), Micron (MU +14.4%) is rallying...

    Though it just issued another weak earnings report (I, II), Micron (MU +14.4%) is rallying today, as investors decide the bad news is baked in. Earnings call comments about strong NAND flash demand might be helping, and so could an upgrade to Outperform from Wedbush, which thinks Micron's beleaguered DRAM business will hit bottom this quarter, and return to profitability in FQ3. Sandisk (SNDK +2.8%) is up in sympathy.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 2 Comments
  • BTX

    Shares of BioTime (BTX -5.5%) slip on profit-taking following two-day rally after the firm...

    Shares of BioTime (BTX -5.5%) slip on profit-taking following two-day rally after the firm disclosed (8-K) that it entered into two agreements with China-based USCN Life Science to license technology and patents, as well as purchase assets related to stem cell research.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • VMW

    Wunderlich lifts its rating on VMware (VMW +3%) to Buy with a $95 price target, seeing the stock...

    Wunderlich lifts its rating on VMware (VMW +3%) to Buy with a $95 price target, seeing the stock attractively valued after its pullback on Oracle's results. Despite constrained IT budgets and other short-term headwinds, VMW is "a fundamental technology behind the current market transition to a utility IT infrastructure."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • AKAM

    Shares of Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) shoot 12% higher after it snaps up rival Cotendo. Another...

    Shares of Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) shoot 12% higher after it snaps up rival Cotendo. Another content-delivery company, Limelight (LLNW +7.3%), is also soaring on the news.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • VVUS

    Vivus (VVUS -14.6%) adds to the losses it saw yesterday afternoon following the release of...

    Vivus (VVUS -14.6%) adds to the losses it saw yesterday afternoon following the release of troubling safety data related to its Qnexa drug. Not helping is a downgrade to Market Perform from Leerink Swann; the firm thinks investors should be careful, given a lack of information on the FDA's standards for acceptable birth defect risk, and believes "there are more downside risks than upside potentials" over the next several quarters.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 4 Comments
  • MJN

    Shares of Mead Johnson Nutrition (MJN -8.7%) are slammed after Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) pulls the...

    Shares of Mead Johnson Nutrition (MJN -8.7%) are slammed after Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) pulls the company's Enfamil Newborn powdered formula from the shelves of its 3,000-plus stores after a newborn Missouri boy who was fed the formula died from a possible rare bacterial infection.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM
  • NEOG

    More on Neogen's (NASDAQ:NEOG) FQ2 miss: The company saw declining sales of several...

    More on Neogen's (NASDAQ:NEOG) FQ2 miss: The company saw declining sales of several products/services, including its rodenticide, disinfectant, and genetic testing solutions. In addition, Neogen's operating expenses rose 12.9% Y/Y, well above its 2.2% revenue growth, thanks largely to higher sales & marketing sending. Shares are now down 15.9%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • JNPR

    Juniper (NYSE:JNPR) gains 3.6% after BMO upgrades shares to Outperform, and lifts its PT to $25....

    Juniper (NYSE:JNPR) gains 3.6% after BMO upgrades shares to Outperform, and lifts its PT to $25. The firm cites lowered expectations, and a belief the telecom capex environment will improve in 1H 2012. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR) +2.5% premarket as Jefferies starts coverage at Buy and a $3 target. As "the...

    Clearwire (CLWR) +2.5% premarket as Jefferies starts coverage at Buy and a $3 target. As "the prospect of spectrum crunch is real... Clearwire’s deep nationwide spectrum, its recently enunciated LTE plan, and liquidity from recent financing to fund the upgrade, make it a viable wholesale partner to any wireless operator."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • NEOG

    Neogen (NASDAQ:NEOG): FQ2 EPS of $0.22 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $44.9M (+2.3% Y/Y) misses by...

    Neogen (NASDAQ:NEOG): FQ2 EPS of $0.22 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $44.9M (+2.3% Y/Y) misses by $2.5M. Shares -1.8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • AM-OLD

    More on American Greetings (NYSE:AM-OLD): Shares -10.3% premarket after reporting FQ3 earnings...

    More on American Greetings (NYSE:AM-OLD): Shares -10.3% premarket after reporting FQ3 earnings fell 37% as higher spending on product improvement and customer relationships masked improved sales, both in North America and internationally. AM reaffirms FY12 outlook but cuts guidance for cash flow from operating activities.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • NTR

    RBC Capital lights up over the prospects for Potash (POT), upgrading shares to Outperform from...

    RBC Capital lights up over the prospects for Potash (POT), upgrading shares to Outperform from Sector Perform and boosting its price target by $8 to $58. Analysts call out POT's increasingly attractive valuation. Shares +1.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) +2.2% premarket as a Bloomberg story discussing the company's...

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) +2.2% premarket as a Bloomberg story discussing the company's attractive valuation following its recent selloff rekindles takeover chatter. "First Solar is still profitable," a Kaufman analyst explains. "So you are buying the best in the industry at a discount price. Certainly for both GE and Siemens (SI), it would diversify their energy platform."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • PDCE

    Oil/gas producer Petroleum Development (PETD) gains 2.6% after agreeing to sell its assets in...

    Oil/gas producer Petroleum Development (PETD) gains 2.6% after agreeing to sell its assets in Texas' Permian Basin to Concho Resources (NYSE:CXO) for $188M. The company plans to use the proceeds from the deal to "retire debt on the Company's revolving credit facility and provide liquidity to fund the Company's 2012 capital budget," which it estimates will be $284M.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • BP

    Heightened disruptions in Iraq and Iran push oil prices higher, as Brent crude futures push back...

    Heightened disruptions in Iraq and Iran push oil prices higher, as Brent crude futures push back over $108 and WTI crude captures the $99 mark. Big Oil premarket: BP +1.6%, XOM +0.7%, CX +0.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM
  • BBBY

    Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY) is down 4.2% post-earnings, as an in-line revenue figure...

    Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY) is down 4.2% post-earnings, as an in-line revenue figure fails to please investors in a stock that was near its 52-week high. However, Oppenheimer (Outperform) is pleased with the company's 4.1% same-store sales growth, and believes its stock price doesn't reflect the company's earnings power, particularly given its stock buyback efforts ($328M in shares repurchased in FQ3). (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM
  • ALSK

    Shares of Alaska Communications Systems (NASDAQ:ALSK) fall 20.5% premarket after the firm...

    Shares of Alaska Communications Systems (NASDAQ:ALSK) fall 20.5% premarket after the firm slashes its quarterly dividend by 77%, to $0.05/share from $0.215/share. The company calls out an anticipated reduced high cost support for wireline and wireless services and the entry of another player in the Alaska wireless market as drivers for its need to keep more cash on hand.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:36 AM | 6 Comments
